title: Biophysical environment
summary: A biophysical  environment is a biotic and abiotic surrounding of an organism or population, and consequently includes the factors that have an influence in their survival, development, and evolution.[1] A biophysical environment can vary in scale from microscopic to global in extent. It can also be subdivided according to its attributes. Examples include the terrestrial environment.[2] The number of biophysical environments is countless, given that each living organism has its own environment.
